container-title: Handbook of Dates, Royal Historical Society, 1955, is essential. For guidance on the legal aspects of conveyancing
For the interpretation of some public records see R. E. Latham, The Amateur Historian
note: 'Inquisitions Post Mortem', IV (Feb. 1953) 'Ministers Accounts', V (Apr. 1953) 'Plea Rolls', all with examples in Latin, translated. For further help with palaeography see K. C. Newton, Medieval Local Records: a reading aid (Historical Association, 1971). FORMULARY
title: Joyce Youings, Local Record Sources in Print and in Progress, J97J-2, Historical Association 1972, supplements these
Sources for English Local History
also be found useful. For working out the dates of many documents
Calendar of Antrobus Deeds before 1625
Introduction, is helpful

'Letters Patent'
